content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` to extract Julia code blocks from a markdown document:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    ast = parse(Markdown.Parser, md)
    julia_code_blocks = String[]

    function process_code_block(node::Markdown.CodeBlock)
        if node.info.language == "julia"
            push!(julia_code_blocks, node.text)
        end
    end

    Markdown.walk(process_code_block, ast)

    return join(julia_code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function uses Julia's built-in Markdown package to parse the given markdown document. It then walks through the parsed Abstract Syntax Tree (AST), looking for code blocks with the language specified as "julia", and collects their contents into a string array. Finally, it joins the code blocks together with double newlines and returns the result.
